concise_definition: n. 布兰夏德（姓氏），专有名词，无通用词义

definitions.explanation_en: A proper noun, typically used as a surname, originating from French, meaning 'one who bleaches' or 'whitener', derived from the Old French word 'blanchir' (to make white). It is not used as a common noun in modern English.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一个专有名词，通常用作姓氏，源自法语，原意为‘漂白者’或‘使变白者’，来自古法语单词 'blanchir'（使变白）。在现代英语中不作为普通名词使用。
definitions.example_en: Jean Blanchard was a pioneering French balloonist in the 18th century.
definitions.example_cn: 让·布兰夏德是18世纪一位开创性的法国气球飞行员。
